course.title: Microsoft Azure Administrator Certification (AZ-104)
course.description: Get ready for the AZ-104 exam. This course covers all the skills needed to administer Microsoft Azure environments, from networking to storage.

lesson.title: Module 1: Manage Azure Identities and Governance

questions.prompt: Which service is used to manage identities and access in Azure?
questions.explanation: Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) is the core identity and access management service.

questions.prompt: RBAC can be applied to individual Azure resources, resource groups, and subscriptions.
questions.explanation: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) offers fine-grained access management across all levels of the Azure hierarchy.

questions.prompt: What is the primary purpose of an Azure subscription?
options: To group resources for billing and management
correctAnswers: To group resources for billing and management
questions.explanation: An Azure subscription is a logical container used to provision resources and is a fundamental unit for billing.

questions.prompt: What is the key benefit of using Azure Policy?
correctAnswers: To enforce organizational standards and assess compliance.
questions.explanation: Azure Policy helps to enforce rules and effects over your resources, ensuring they remain compliant with corporate standards.

questions.prompt: Which of the following is not a default RBAC role?
questions.explanation: Network Admin is not a default RBAC role. 'Network Contributor' is a default role for managing network resources.

content.title: Working with Azure Storage Accounts and Blobs

questions.prompt: What is the most secure method for granting temporary, delegated access to Azure Storage resources?
questions.explanation: A Shared Access Signature (SAS) provides a secure, time-limited, and delegated URI to grant access to your storage resources.

questions.prompt: You can change a storage account's redundancy option (e.g., LRS to GRS) after creation.
questions.explanation: You can upgrade redundancy options (e.g., LRS to GRS) but you cannot downgrade.

questions.prompt: Which type of storage is best suited for unstructured data like images and videos?
questions.explanation: Azure Blob storage is optimized for storing massive amounts of unstructured data.

questions.prompt: What is the primary purpose of a 'hot' access tier in Azure Blob Storage?
correctAnswers: For frequently accessed data that is actively in use.
questions.explanation: The 'hot' tier is optimized for data that is accessed frequently, with higher storage costs but lower access costs.

questions.prompt: Which of the following is a managed file share service for the cloud?
questions.explanation: Azure Files provides managed file shares that can be accessed via the SMB protocol.

lesson.title: Module 3: Deploy and Manage Azure Compute Resources

questions.prompt: Which Azure resource ensures high availability by distributing VMs across different fault domains and update domains?
questions.explanation: An Availability Set distributes VMs across different physical hardware in a single data center to provide high availability.

questions.prompt: An Availability Zone can protect applications from a single data center failure.
questions.explanation: Availability Zones are physically separate data centers within an Azure region, providing protection from entire data center failures.

questions.prompt: What is the primary purpose of an Azure Virtual Machine Scale Set?
options: To automatically scale the number of VM instances
correctAnswers: To automatically scale the number of VM instances
questions.explanation: VM Scale Sets enable you to create and manage a group of identical, load-balanced VMs that can automatically scale based on demand.

questions.prompt: What is the purpose of an Azure Bastion host?
correctAnswers: To provide secure and seamless RDP/SSH connectivity to VMs without public IP addresses.
questions.explanation: Azure Bastion is a fully managed PaaS service that provides secure and private remote access to your virtual machines.

questions.prompt: Which service should you use to run a containerized application without managing the underlying virtual machines?
questions.explanation: AKS is a managed Kubernetes service that simplifies the deployment, management, and scaling of containerized applications.

lesson.title: Module 4: Configure and Manage Virtual Networking

questions.prompt: What is the purpose of a Network Security Group (NSG)?
options: To control inbound and outbound traffic to network interfaces
To distribute network traffic across VMs
correctAnswers: To control inbound and outbound traffic to network interfaces
questions.explanation: NSGs act as a virtual firewall for your Azure virtual network.

questions.prompt: Network peering allows two virtual networks in the same region to communicate as if they were one.
questions.explanation: Virtual network peering connects two Azure virtual networks, enabling resources in both networks to communicate.

questions.prompt: Which of the following is a private IP address range?
questions.explanation: The 10.0.0.0/8 range is one of the three private IP address ranges defined by RFC 1918.

questions.prompt: What is the main function of an Azure Load Balancer?
correctAnswers: To distribute incoming network traffic across multiple back-end resources or virtual machines.
questions.explanation: A load balancer distributes traffic to improve application availability and responsiveness.

questions.prompt: Which network component is used to connect an on-premises network to an Azure virtual network?
questions.explanation: Both a VPN Gateway (Virtual Network Gateway) and ExpressRoute can be used for hybrid connectivity.

content.title: Azure AD Connect and Authentication Methods

questions.prompt: What is the core component for synchronizing on-premises AD with Azure AD?
questions.explanation: Azure AD Connect is the primary tool for synchronizing on-premises identities to the cloud.

questions.prompt: Password Hash Synchronization (PHS) is a form of single sign-on (SSO).
questions.explanation: PHS is a sign-in method that synchronizes a hash of user passwords. SSO is a related but separate concept.

questions.prompt: Which authentication method uses a proxy agent in your on-premises environment?
questions.explanation: PTA agents run on-premises to validate users' passwords against their on-premises Active Directory.

questions.prompt: What is the key benefit of using a hybrid identity solution?
correctAnswers: It allows users to use a single identity for both on-premises and cloud resources.
questions.explanation: A hybrid identity solution provides a single, unified identity for users across a hybrid IT environment.

questions.prompt: Which of the following scenarios requires Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS)?
options: If you need to use on-premises multi-factor authentication
If you need to support Windows Hello for Business
If you want to manage identities for guest users
correctAnswers: If you need to support Windows Hello for Business
questions.explanation: While there are many uses, ADFS is often required for more advanced scenarios like on-premises MFA or specific features like Windows Hello for Business.

lesson.title: Module 6: Monitor and Backup Azure Resources

content.title: Using Azure Monitor and Recovery Services

questions.prompt: Which service is the core monitoring solution for collecting metrics, logs, and traces?
questions.explanation: Azure Monitor is a comprehensive service for collecting, analyzing, and acting on telemetry from your cloud and on-premises environments.

questions.prompt: Azure Backup supports backing up on-premises data.
questions.explanation: Azure Backup can back up data from on-premises machines, not just Azure resources.

questions.prompt: What is the primary purpose of a Log Analytics workspace?
options: To store and analyze log data from various sources
correctAnswers: To store and analyze log data from various sources
questions.explanation: A Log Analytics workspace is a unique environment for Azure Monitor log data storage.

questions.prompt: What is a 'Recovery Services vault' used for in Azure?
correctAnswers: To store backups and disaster recovery data for various Azure and on-premises workloads.
questions.explanation: A Recovery Services vault is a secure storage container for your backups and recovery points.

questions.prompt: Which service provides a centralized view of your security posture across Azure?
questions.explanation: Azure Security Center (now part of Microsoft Defender for Cloud) provides unified security management and advanced threat protection.

lesson.title: Module 7: Plan and Implement Business Continuity

questions.prompt: What is the term for the maximum acceptable time an application can be unavailable after a disaster?
questions.explanation: RTO is the time goal for recovering from an outage. RPO is the data loss goal.

questions.prompt: Azure Site Recovery is a disaster recovery service for both Azure and on-premises workloads.
questions.explanation: Azure Site Recovery orchestrates and automates replication of VMs and physical servers to Azure.

questions.prompt: Which of the following is NOT a feature of Azure Backup?
questions.explanation: Azure Site Recovery handles continuous application failover, while Azure Backup is focused on data backup and restoration.

questions.prompt: What is the main benefit of using soft delete for Azure Blob Storage?
correctAnswers: It protects against accidental or malicious deletion of data by allowing you to restore deleted objects.
questions.explanation: Soft delete retains deleted data for a specified period, giving you a chance to recover it.

questions.prompt: Which backup method is most suitable for frequently changing databases with low RPO requirements?
questions.explanation: Transactional log backups capture all changes to a database, allowing for restoration to a specific point in time with minimal data loss.

lesson.title: Module 8: Manage Costs and Azure Subscriptions

questions.prompt: Which service helps you create budgets and view a breakdown of your Azure spend?
questions.explanation: This service helps you analyze, manage, and optimize your costs.

questions.prompt: A resource group is a unit for billing.
questions.explanation: A subscription is a billing unit. A resource group is a logical container for related resources.

questions.prompt: Which of the following is a cost optimization recommendation from Azure Advisor?
options: Use a more expensive VM size
questions.explanation: Azure Advisor provides recommendations for optimizing costs, reliability, and security.

questions.prompt: What is an Azure Reserved Virtual Machine Instance (RI)?
correctAnswers: A billing benefit that allows you to save money by committing to a one-year or three-year plan for VM usage.
questions.explanation: Azure RIs provide significant savings compared to pay-as-you-go pricing for consistent workloads.

questions.prompt: Which tool can be used to set a spending limit on a subscription?
questions.explanation: Budgets can be used to monitor and set spending limits on a subscription or resource group.

questions.prompt: What is a deployment slot in Azure App Service?
options: A way to host multiple applications on one VM
A separate environment to test new versions of a web app
A method for scaling out web apps
correctAnswers: A separate environment to test new versions of a web app
questions.explanation: Deployment slots provide a safe way to test a new version of your web app before swapping it to production.

questions.prompt: Azure App Service is a PaaS (Platform-as-a-Service) offering.
questions.explanation: Azure App Service is a fully managed PaaS offering for building and hosting web apps.

questions.prompt: Which of the following is NOT a scaling option for Azure App Service?
questions.explanation: Vertical scaling (changing the VM size) is not an option within App Service. You can only scale horizontally by adding more instances or manually/automatically scaling up the App Service Plan.

questions.prompt: What is the purpose of an App Service Plan?
correctAnswers: It defines the underlying set of compute resources for your web app to run on.
questions.explanation: An App Service Plan specifies the region, VM size, and scale count of the web app.

questions.prompt: What is the primary benefit of using a custom domain with an Azure web app?
options: It makes the web app more secure
It allows you to use a user-friendly URL instead of the default azurewebsites.net address
It provides a free SSL certificate
correctAnswers: It allows you to use a user-friendly URL instead of the default azurewebsites.net address
questions.explanation: Custom domains provide a professional and memorable URL for your web app.

lesson.title: Module 10: Implement and Manage Azure Functions

questions.prompt: What is the core concept of serverless computing?
options: You don't need to write code
The cloud provider manages the server infrastructure
You pay a fixed monthly fee
correctAnswers: The cloud provider manages the server infrastructure
questions.explanation: Serverless computing abstracts away the server management, allowing you to focus on your code.

questions.prompt: Azure Functions can be triggered by a timer.
questions.explanation: A timer trigger allows a function to be executed on a predefined schedule.

questions.prompt: Which of the following is a common pricing model for Azure Functions?
questions.explanation: The consumption plan charges you based on the resources consumed by your function, not for the underlying server infrastructure.

questions.prompt: What is the purpose of an 'event-driven' architecture?
correctAnswers: It is an architecture pattern where a system's behavior is determined by events, which trigger actions.
questions.explanation: In an event-driven architecture, components respond to events rather than communicating directly with each other.

questions.prompt: Which service can be used to monitor the performance of your Azure Functions?
questions.explanation: Application Insights is a feature of Azure Monitor that provides performance management and monitoring for your applications, including Azure Functions.
